title: Ticket #6294: Correctly set cgroup limits with virtual memory and soft limits
description: When setting virtual memory cgroup limits, the limit must be greater than or equal to the (non-virtual) memory limit. On the off chance that we are reusing a cgroup, and the virtual memory size changes from job to job, we can fail to set the memory limit, if then second job is trying to set a lower virtual memory limit than the previous job.
